text: We analysed the action of <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the expression of NF-kappaB - responsive genes in vivo .

To this end , HeLa cells were transfected with <extra_id_0> FLAG-Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> FLAG-Tat C(22,25,27)A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> FLAG-Tat R(49-57)A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and 48 h later the expression of a number of NF-kappaB - dependent genes was analysed by real-time PCR .

<extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> significantly increased the expression of <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> LTA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> NFKBIA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , while the mutants <extra_id_0> Tat C(22,25,27)A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Tat R(49-57)A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were ineffective ( Figure 5A-E ) .

text: The <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transactivation of the NF-kappaB - dependent genes was abolished when cells were transfected with <extra_id_0> siRNA p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , indicating that the <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcriptional activation was mediated by <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 5A-E ) .

Differently , the expression of the NF-kappaB - independent genes <extra_id_0> GAPDH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> ACTB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was unaffected by wild-type and <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants ( Figure 5F and G ) .

These results were consistent with the requirement of both the cysteine-rich and arginine-rich domains of <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to enhance the NF-kappaB activity , suggesting that the up-regulation of NF-kappaB - responsive genes by <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> might occur through physical interaction of the viral protein with <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IkappaB-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Jaspar-based analysis ( http : / / jaspar.genereg.net / ) predicted three putative NF-kappaB enhancers in the proximal promoter region of the <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene : NF-kappaB1 , -1023 / -1014 nucleotides ; NF-kappaB2 , -661 / -652 nucleotides ; NF-kappaB3 , +370 / +379 nucleotides ( Supplementary Figure S3A ) .

To validate the predicted NF-kappaB binding sites of the <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , we stimulated HeLa cells with <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a well-known NF-kappaB inducer , and measured the expression levels of <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by real-time PCR , and the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> occupancy of the NF-kappaB sites by ChIP .
